result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant received copy of information.
Defendant waives reading of information. 

NOT GUILTY plea(s) entered.

BY THE COURT:  Bond continued.

3:18 PM Prosecuting attorney Jedidiah J Dodge in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Brody L Ostrowski appeared by video, in custody from the Waupaca County jail.  Attorney Erik John Mcfarland in court for Brody L Ostrowski. 

Atty Dodge calls the case and states the appearances. 
Defendant confirms he can see and hear. 

Defendant waives right to preliminary hearing. 
Court questions defendant regarding waiver of preliminary hearing. 
Court questions defendant's attorney.
Court finds the defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived the preliminary hearing. 

BY THE COURT: On the defendants waiver of the preliminary hearing, Court determines, based on the facts contained in the complaint, there is sufficient probable cause and binds the defendant over for trial.

Atty McFarland has not seen the information. 
Atty Dodge states the information was filed on 6/29.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for August 1, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Pre-trial conference on August 1, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Preliminary hearing on July 5, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

2:20 PM Defendant Brody L Ostrowski appeared by video, in custody at Waupaca County Jail.   Attorney Erik John Mcfarland in court for Brody L Ostrowski.  Attorney Andrew Mutchler in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Atty McFarland had been appointed on this case this morning.

Atty McFarland has not been able to meet with his client as of yet.
Court informs defendant of the charges and maximum penalties.
Attorney/Defendant waives reading of the complaint.
Attorney does not waive time limits for the preliminary hearing to be held.
Defendant is currently on a probation hold.

Court advises defendant of right to counsel/public defender representation.

BY THE COURT:  Bond continued.
